title: Create the Gapminder dataset
text:
# Import necessary libraries
import pandas as pd
from gapminder import gapminder

# Rename 'lifeExp' to 'life_expectancy' and 'gdpPercap' to 'gdp_per_capita'
gapminder = gapminder.rename(columns={'lifeExp': 'life_expectancy',
                                      'pop': 'population_millions', 
                                      'gdpPercap': 'gdp_per_capita'})

# Convert population to millions
gapminder['population_millions'] = gapminder['population_millions'] / 1_000_000

# Create a new pandas DataFrame from the modified gapminder data
gapminder_df = pd.DataFrame(gapminder)

# Save the DataFrame as a CSV file
gapminder_df.to_csv('gapminder.csv', index=False)

# Print the first 3 rows of the DataFrame
print(gapminder_df.head(3))

       country continent  year  life_expectancy  population_millions  \
0  Afghanistan      Asia  1952           28.801             8.425333   
1  Afghanistan      Asia  1957           30.332             9.240934   
2  Afghanistan      Asia  1962           31.997            10.267083   

   gdp_per_capita  
0      779.445314  
1      820.853030  
2      853.100710

title: Country Analysis: Japan
text:
library(ggplot2)
df <- read.csv("gapminder.csv")
japan <- subset(df, country == "Japan")

par(mfrow = c(3, 1))  # Layout for 3 stacked plots

plot(japan$year, japan$life_expectancy, type = "b", pch = 19,
     main = "Life Expectancy in Japan", xlab = "Year", ylab = "Life Expectancy")

plot(japan$year, japan$gdp_per_capita, type = "b", pch = 19,
     main = "GDP per Capita in Japan", xlab = "Year", ylab = "GDP per Capita")

plot(japan$year, japan$population_millions, type = "b", pch = 19,
     main = "Population in Japan (millions)", xlab = "Year", ylab = "Population (millions)")

title: Life Expectancy vs GDP per Capita
text:
library(ggplot2)
df <- read.csv("gapminder.csv")

ggplot(df, aes(x = gdp_per_capita, y = life_expectancy, color = continent)) +
  geom_point() +
  scale_x_log10() +
  labs(title = "Life Expectancy vs GDP per Capita")

title: Life Expectancy vs Population
text:
library(ggplot2)
df <- read.csv("gapminder.csv")

ggplot(df, aes(x = population_millions, y = life_expectancy, color = continent)) +
  geom_point() +
  labs(title = "Life Expectancy vs Population")

text:
